1.name: Warborne
1.details: Each time War takes or deals damage to enemy Hero, he gains a stack of Warborne for a short duration. Each stack of Warborne grants War increased life steal (maximum 10 stacks).

2.name: Decimate
2.details:
War swings down his glaive in a target direction, dealing physical damage (scaling with physical power) to all enemies hit.

At maximum stacks of Warborne, Decimate will send out a flaming wave in the same target direction instead, reaching further and dealing more damage.

3.name: Whirlwind
3.details:
War swings his glaive in front of him, blocking all projectiles from a target direction, except for ultimate and turret.

At maximum stacks of Warborne, War will weave his glaive around, blocking all projectiles from all directions instead while dealing physical damage (scaling with physical power).

4.name: Scorching Edge
4.details:
War enters a charging state when he drags his glaive in flame, gaining increased movement speed during the charge.

War can recast again to swing his glaive upward, dealing physical damage (scaling with physical power) to all enemies hit in a line and briefly slowing them.

If War charges for more than a while, he will deal more damage and will knock the enemies up before slowing them.

At maximum stacks of Warborne, War does not need to charge and will immediately cast Scorching Edge.

5.name: Arena of Blood
5.details:
War picks a target enemy Hero, then slams down his glaive and creates an arena around him. Inside the arena, he instantly gains maximum stacks of Warborne.

Enemy heroes who try to walk out or into the arena will take physical damage (scaling with physical power) and become greatly slowed for a short duration.
